lexUnit.name: behind.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: have performed or orchestrated an action.

sentence.text: But the information minister suggested there was a foreign hand behind it .
Authorities believe militants fleeing South Waziristan to their new havens far closer to Peshawar are probably behind many of the attacks .
Abbas and his aides said they would hunt and arrest those behind Tuesday night 's bombing .
" Our initial assessment is that one or more insurgent groups are behind the attack , " said Maj. Derrick Cheng , a spokesman for U. S. forces in northern Iraq .
Other observers speculated that Lebanon-based Hezbollah was behind the bombing .
And behind it all , more are seeing the hand of neighboring Pakistan .
Punjabi extremists were also believed to be behind near-simultaneous attacks on three police buildings in Lahore that killed 14 people on Oct. 15.

Richard Holbrooke , the U. S. special envoy to Afghanistan and Pakistan , said the Taliban behind the attack were part of a set of extremist groups operating in the border areas between Afghanistan and Pakistan .
Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak said " foreign fingers " were behind the attack .

Tueni 's assassination strengthened calls for two long-standing demands of anti-Syria lawmakers : the ouster of Lebanese President Emile Lahoud and the establishment of an international tribunal to try those behind the killings in Lebanon .

The top U. S. commander in Iraq , Army Gen. Ray Odierno , said he was convinced that the insurgent group Al Qaeda in Iraq was behind the latest attacks , perhaps acting in coordination with some Baathists .
Egypt has 'conclusive ' evidence that Al Qaeda group was behind church bombing
Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak accused unnamed foreign elements of being behind the attack .
While many described it as another in a series of episodes of sectarian violence , Alexandria 's governor said Al Qaeda could be behind the bombing .
Some interpreted the statement to mean it was unclear whether Muslim extremists were behind the attack .
" Everyone hoped that would be the case here , and no one could say that the U. S. was behind it , " he said .
